headerDescription: Register your service and metadata to get published on the marketplace. You can find a quick overview of the service release process below.
descHeading: Publish your company services inside the Catena-X marketplace
descMessage: Register and publish your company services on the Cofinity-X marketplace or go to “Your Services” to manage your created offerings.

stepper.validateAndPublish: Verify Data and Submit Your Service

stepperDescription.marketCard: Create your “Service Card” for the marketplace. This card is your first touchpoint with customers. Provide a title, description, and a service cover image.
stepperDescription.servicePage: Provide detailed information for your service's detail page, including a long description in English and German, a supporting document such as a summary or exposé, and provider details.
stepperDescription.contractAndConsent: To publish your offer as a Catena-X Qualified Service on the marketplace, you need to accept the T&Cs and provide the Conformity Service Certificate.
stepperDescription.technicalIntegration: If your service requires technical integration, select the respective technical user(s). Otherwise, choose “None” and proceed.
stepperDescription.validateAndPublish: Review the summary of all your service registration inputs. We will validate your service registration shortly after the service submission.

step1.headerDescription: The following input fields and uploads are used to create you “Service Card” which will be placed inside the marketplace. The service card is the first touchpoint with the customer.

step2.headerDescription: Please provide detailed information for your service's detail page.
step2.pleaseEnterValidHomePageURL: Please enter a valid url - eg: https://catena-x.net
step2.pleaseEnterValidEmail: Please enter a valid Customer Contact E-Mail

step3.headerDescription: To publish your offer as a Catena-X Qualified Service on the marketplace, please accept the T&Cs and upload your Conformity Service Certificate.

technicalIntegration.headerDescription: If your service requires technical integration, select the respective technical user(s). Otherwise, choose “None” and proceed.
technicalIntegration.technicalUserSetupMandatory: Please select at least one technical user permission for the service tech user profile
technicalIntegration.technicalUserProfileError: Error while updating technical user profiles
technicalIntegration.noneOption: none (no technical user needed to run the app/service)

step4.headerDescription: Below you can find a summary of all your service registration inputs. Please check your entered data carefully before sending the service for release. We will validate your service registration shortly after the service submission.

serviceReleaseForm.OnlyOneFileAllowed: Only one file for upload allowed

error.title: Submission was not successful.
error.message: Please try it again or come back later.

submit.headerTitle: Thank you for submitting the service!
submit.headerDescription: After a review by a Cofinity-X administrator, you will receive
submit.headerDescriptionComplete: further information on the service release.

defaultValues.conformityDocumentsDescription: To publish your service on the marketplace, a number of Catena-X specific agreements need to get signed by you. Please have a look at the mentioned agreements and agree to them via the checklist approval.

serviceoverview.headerDescription: Register a new service and manage your current service offerings. In the overview, you will find services that have already been published as well as offers that are still being created or have been rejected.

serviceDeactivate.description: Deactivation of service will deactivate the service offer inside the Catena-X marketplace. Any current active subscription will stay active and customers wont be effected by the deactivation. New subscriptions are not possible.
serviceDeactivate.checkboxLabel: Hereby I confirm that I have read the business service terms and conditions and that I am deactivating my company business services from the marketplace with immediate effect. I understand that it is not possible to self-reverse the deactivation.
serviceDeactivate.checkboxErrorMsg: Please confirm that you have read the deactivation impact above before proceeding

serviceSubscription.headline: Service Subscriptions
serviceSubscription.headlineDescription: Derzeit sind keine Daten verfügbar. Bitte ändern Sie die Ansicht oder versuchen Sie es später erneut.
serviceSubscription.description: Do you wan't to rather use the autosetup; connect your service to automate marketplace subscription build
serviceSubscription.subscriptionHeading: >> there are already active subscriptions for the service {serviceName}

document.heading: Relevant Documents
document.message: The terms of use, as well as the data models and further information can be viewed by clicking on the documents shared below.

register.title: Activate Service Subscription
register.subtitle: for
register.description:
In order to activate the subscription of {{company}}, follow these steps below,

1. Activate the service subscription request.
2. Customer will be informed about the successfully activation
register.descriptionWithTechUser:
In order to activate the subscription of {{company}}, follow these steps below,

1. Activate the service subscription request.
2. System - technical user (if needed) will get generated and credentials getting shared.
3. Configure your service with the specific technical user to ensure that the service is fully usable
register.sectionDescription: Like in App Subcription: Below the technical user profile used to create the technical user for the app tenant is shared. With clicking on “Confirm” below, the technical user is getting created with the respective configured permissions. Please note the technical user is customer specific.

activation.title: Service Subscription Activated
activation.subtitle: for
activation.successDescription:
The service is now activated and technical user was successfully created.
Please find the necessary user details below.
activation.successDescriptionWithTechUser:
The service is now activated and technical user was successfully created.
Please find the necessary user details below.

adminBoard.headerDescription: All the requested services will be managed from this page.
adminBoard.errorApproveMsg: Service not activated. Something went wrong.
adminBoard.successDeclineMsg: Service got successfully declined and provider informed
adminBoard.errorDeclineMsg: Service decline failed. Something went wrong.

declineModal.title: Reject Service Release Request {appName}
declineModal.subheading: Are you sure you want to reject the service release request ?
declineModal.declineReason1Label: Create a notification & email message to inform the service provider/manager about the rejection
declineModal.declineReason2Label: An individual message with additional details can get shared by adding the details into the input field below
declineModal.declineReason3Label: The service will get set back to the status “in progress“

documents.heading: Documents
documents.message: In the following section additional documents/information are shared by the app provider. Click on the document name to download them.

provider.heading: Provider Information
provider.message: If you have any question, want to get in contact or visit the provider website, you can find all necessary information below.

technicalUserSetup.heading: Technical Integration
technicalUserSetup.message: The technical user profile defined below shows the user permissions that are automatically assigned to the technical user created during the service activation.
technicalUserSetup.roleDescription: The role description is expected to get displayed here in future.

retryOverlay.title: Something went wrong
retryOverlay.description: The data could not get loaded, please try it again or go back to the previous page.
